etymology.description: Depicts a simplified hand holding a thread
etymology.interpretation: 乃(乃) (nǎi, 'so') originally depicted a hand holding an object, symbolizing a connection or linkage, which lends itself to meanings related to causation and result, like 'so' or 'then.'

examples.chinese: 他受尽磨难(他受盡磨難)，乃成大器(乃成大器)。
examples.pinyin: Tā shòu jìn mó nàn, nǎi chéng dà qì.
examples.english: He endured many hardships, so he became great.

examples.chinese: 山明水秀(山明水秀)，乃令人心旷神怡(乃令人心曠神怡)。
examples.pinyin: Shān míng shuǐ xiù, nǎi lìng rén xīn kuàng shén yí.
examples.english: The scenery is picturesque, so it refreshes one's mind.
